intro: Tolypanthus maclurei, commonly known as the Maclure's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny stems. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are broad, often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Tolypanthus maclurei is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
